    • Method Detail

      • getQuickNavigateInfo

        public java.lang.String getQuickNavigateInfo(PsiElement element,
                                             PsiElement originalElement)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider
        Returns the text to show in the Ctrl-hover popup for the specified element.
        Specified by:
        getQuickNavigateInfo in interface DocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which the documentation is requested (for example, if the mouse is over a method reference, this will be the method to which the reference is resolved).
        originalElement - the element under the mouse cursor
        Returns:
        the documentation to show, or null if the provider can't provide any documentation for this element. Documentation can contain HTML markup. If HTML special characters need to be shown in popup, they should be properly escaped.

      • getUrlFor

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getUrlFor(PsiElement element,
                                                  PsiElement originalElement)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider
        Returns the list of possible URLs to show as external documentation for the specified element.
        Specified by:
        getUrlFor in interface DocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which the documentation is requested (for example, if the mouse is over a method reference, this will be the method to which the reference is resolved).
        originalElement - the element under the mouse cursor
        Returns:
        the list of URLs to open in the browser or to use for showing documentation internally (ExternalDocumentationProvider). If the list contains a single URL, it will be opened. If the list contains multiple URLs, the user will be prompted to choose one of them. For ExternalDocumentationProvider, first URL, yielding non-empty result in ExternalDocumentationProvider.fetchExternalDocumentation(Project, PsiElement, List) will be used.

      • parseContext

        public Pair<PsiElement,PsiComment> parseContext(PsiElement startPoint)
        Description copied from interface: CodeDocumentationProvider
        Examines PSI hierarchy identified by the given 'start' element trying to find element which can be documented and it's doc comment (if any).

        Example: 

           int test() {
     return [caret] 1;
   }
        PSI element at the caret (return element) is an entry point. This method is expected to return PSI method element and 'null' as the existing doc comment then.
        Specified by:
        parseContext in interface CodeDocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        startPoint - start traversal point
        Returns:
        comment anchor which is a given element or its anchor if the one is found and its doc comment (if existing). This method may return 'null' as an indication that no doc comment anchor and existing comment is available; returned pair must have non-null PSI element and nullable existing comment references then

      • generateDocumentationContentStub

        public java.lang.String generateDocumentationContentStub(PsiComment _comment)
        Description copied from interface: CodeDocumentationProvider
        Generate documentation comment content for given context.
        Specified by:
        generateDocumentationContentStub in interface CodeDocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        _comment - context psi comment
        Returns:
        documentation content for given context if any

      • generateDoc

        public java.lang.String generateDoc(PsiElement element,
                                    PsiElement originalElement)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider

        Callback for asking the doc provider for the complete documentation. Underlying implementation may be time-consuming, that's why this method is expected not to be called from EDT.

        One can use DocumentationMarkup to get proper content layout. Typical sample will look like this: 

         DEFINITION_START + definition + DEFINITION_END +
 CONTENT_START + main description + CONTENT_END +
 SECTIONS_START +
   SECTION_HEADER_START + section name +
     SECTION_SEPARATOR + "<p>" + section content + SECTION_END +
   ... +
 SECTIONS_END

        To show different content on mouse hover in editor, DocumentationProvider.generateHoverDoc(PsiElement, PsiElement) should be implemented.
        Specified by:
        generateDoc in interface DocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which the documentation is requested (for example, if the mouse is over a method reference, this will be the method to which the reference is resolved).
        originalElement - the element under the mouse cursor
        Returns:
        target element's documentation, or null if provider is unable to generate documentation for the given element

      • generateRenderedDoc

        public java.lang.String generateRenderedDoc(PsiElement element)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider
        This is used to display rendered documentation in editor, in place of corresponding documentation comment's text. Documentation comment PSI elements should implement PsiDocCommentBase for this functionality to work. Value returned by PsiDocCommentBase.getOwner() will be passed as element parameter to this method.
        Specified by:
        generateRenderedDoc in interface DocumentationProvider
        See Also:
        DocumentationProvider.collectDocComments(PsiFile, Consumer)

      • collectDocComments

        public void collectDocComments(PsiFile file,
                               java.util.function.Consumer<PsiDocCommentBase> sink)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider
        This defines documentation comments in file, which can be rendered in place. HTML content to be displayed will be obtained using DocumentationProvider.generateRenderedDoc(PsiElement) method.
        Specified by:
        collectDocComments in interface DocumentationProvider

      • getDocumentationElementForLink

        public PsiElement getDocumentationElementForLink(PsiManager psiManager,
                                                 java.lang.String link,
                                                 PsiElement context)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider
        Returns the target element for a link in a documentation comment. The link needs to use the DocumentationManagerProtocol.PSI_ELEMENT_PROTOCOL protocol.
        Specified by:
        getDocumentationElementForLink in interface DocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        psiManager - the PSI manager for the project in which the documentation is requested.
        link - the text of the link, not including the protocol.
        context - the element from which the navigation is performed.
        Returns:
        the navigation target, or null if the link couldn't be resolved.
        See Also:
        DocumentationManagerUtil.createHyperlink(StringBuilder, String, String, boolean)

      • fetchExternalDocumentation

        public java.lang.String fetchExternalDocumentation(Project project,
                                                   PsiElement element,
                                                   java.util.List<java.lang.String> docUrls)
        Specified by:
        fetchExternalDocumentation in interface ExternalDocumentationProvider

      • hasDocumentationFor

        public boolean hasDocumentationFor(PsiElement element,
                                   PsiElement originalElement)
        Description copied from interface: ExternalDocumentationProvider
        Quick check for existence of external documentation for specified element. Called from action update, so must be fast. If not implemented, update check is performed by calling DocumentationProvider.getUrlFor(PsiElement, PsiElement).
        Specified by:
        hasDocumentationFor in interface ExternalDocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        element - the element to check for existence of documentation
        originalElement - the element at caret (on which the action was invoked)
        Returns:
        true if the external documentation action should be enabled, false otherwise.

      • canPromptToConfigureDocumentation

        public boolean canPromptToConfigureDocumentation(PsiElement element)
        Description copied from interface: ExternalDocumentationProvider
        Checks if the provider is capable of asking the user to configure external documentation for an element.
        Specified by:
        canPromptToConfigureDocumentation in interface ExternalDocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which no documentation was found
        Returns:
        true if the element is applicable to this provider and the provider has a UI to configure the documentation location, false otherwise

      • promptToConfigureDocumentation

        public void promptToConfigureDocumentation(PsiElement element)
        Description copied from interface: ExternalDocumentationProvider
        Prompts the user to configure the external documentation for an element if none was found.
        Specified by:
        promptToConfigureDocumentation in interface ExternalDocumentationProvider
        Parameters:
        element - the element for which no documentation was found

      • getCustomDocumentationElement

        public PsiElement getCustomDocumentationElement(Editor editor,
                                                PsiFile file,
                                                PsiElement contextElement,
                                                int targetOffset)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentationProvider
        Override this method if standard platform's choice for target PSI element to show documentation for (element either declared or referenced at target offset) isn't suitable for your language. For example, it could be a keyword where there's no PsiReference, but for which users might benefit from context help.
        Specified by:
        getCustomDocumentationElement in interface DocumentationProvider
        contextElement - the leaf PSI element in file at target offset
        targetOffset - equals to caret offset for 'Quick Documentation' action, and to offset under mouse cursor for documentation shown on mouse hover
        Returns:
        target PSI element to show documentation for, or null if it should be determined by standard platform's logic (default behaviour)
